sub_title: MBA | Bioengineer | Passionate about driving positive transformational change
summary:
Passionate and results-oriented Bioengineer who is dedicated to having a positive impact through my work.

I am currently undergoing my MBA at Rotterdam School of Management, concentrating in international and sustainable business. Available to start work in January 2024 (sponsorship not required). 

As Senior Program Manager at BIO Ventures for Global Health (BVGH), I managed diverse global health programs and facilitated product development pipelines. This ranged from advancing diagnostics and drug development for neglected diseases (SDG 3, 9, 17) to enhancing oncology diagnostic and treatment capacities in East Africa. I was also responsible for negotiating access to affordable cancer medicines between pharmaceutical manufacturers and African hospitals and governments (SDG 9, 10, 17). I served as the key touch point between multi-sector stakeholders and was responsible for aligning health solutions with both corporate CSR priorities and governmental strategic vision. I developed efficient reporting systems to consolidate surveys and assessments and communicated the results through peer-reviewed publications (links in my CV), company reports (internal and external), and impact/CSR reports for corporate funders. Through these experiences, I honed my ability to analyze complex health challenges, identify opportunities for improvement, and design tailored solutions that consider both environmental and human health implications at global and local levels. 

I believe that many of our global crises—experienced thus far and yet to be faced—stem from an issue of resource allocation and waste reduction. Ultimately, we live in an industry-driven world. While I have demonstrated my ability to implement positive change professionally and personally, I pursued my International and Sustainable MBA to arm myself with the business skills and experience to expand my impact to the private sector and align health and climate equity with multinational corporate strategy.

treasury_media.description: Health officials from Rwanda Biomedical Centre (RBC) has said that while 750 patients are diagnosed every year with cervical cancer, the majority are the ones left undiagnosed due to lack of awareness. This was disclosed during a cervical cancer...

treasury_media.title: Disrupting the Emerging Cancer Crisis in Africa
Canadian investigators partner through WIPO Re:Search to improve diagnosis of Chagas disease—a significant public health problem in Latin America — Perspectives on Global Health
treasury_media.description: BIO Ventures for Global Health (BVGH) connected Dr. Ndao and Dr. Horacio Bach—an antibody engineering expert at the University of British Columbia — through WIPO Re:Search, enabling them to combine their expertise and join forces to address the gaps in Chagas disease diagnostics.

treasury_media.title: 2019_WIPO Re:Search - A platform for the elimination of Schistosomiasis

treasury_media.title: Continuing medical education during COVID-19: virtual training for gynecologic oncology management in Rwanda
treasury_media.description: In response to Rwandan OB-GYNs’ need for improved in-service oncology management training and continuing education during the COVID-19 pandemic, BVGH, RBC, and Rwandan and international academic partners designed and held an innovative, multi-week gynecologic cancer management training program targeting Rwanda’s OB-GYNs.

projects.title: Build a PCR Machine Under $120
projects.description:
Developed a working PCR under $120 for our Spring 2017 Biodevice Course. 

Responsible for design, obtaining materials, building, and testing prototype. 

Coded to run for 32 full cycles and proven to work comparable to industrial grade PCR machine.

contributors.headline: MBA | Bioengineer | Passionate about driving positive transformational change

profile_positions.description:
Engaged in two 4-6 week consultancy projects with a team of 5 MBA Candidates. 
•	Rolls-Royce Benelux: Delivered five data-driven recommendations to achieve their target of 30% inventory reduction by 2024. 
•	Triodos Investment Bank: Identified and proposed 3 key industry funders for client-base expansion, backed by market analysis and differentiation strategies. Successfully influenced Triodos to integrate 2 out of 4 recommended strategic components into their fund management and reporting strategy.
profile_positions.title: MBA Consultant

profile_positions.description:
HIGHLIGHTED PROJECTS 

1. Rwandan Cervical Cancer Early Detection Services 
• Spearheaded a new partnership with Rwandan Ministry of Health to introduce HPV-based cervical cancer educate, screen, and treat services to rural Rwanda.
• Secured and managed $300,000 funding pool from Johnson & Johnson, Faber Daeufer & Itrato, & GardaWorld.
• Managed equipment procurement, training for 700+ health care providers, and launch of services at 16 Rwandan health facilities.
• Successfully screened 6,000+ women for HPV in six weeks, detected and treated 30+ cancers, and coordinated free transportation and treatment for all women with cancers detected through the program.

2. Three Part Oncology Capacity Building in Cote d’Ivoire
• Designed, implemented, and managed three-part oncology capacity building program, built in partnership and with direction from local governmental oncology leaders and medical professionals. 
• Breast cancer pathology workshop: Coordinated training nearly 100 pathologists from 10 African countries. 
• Multidisciplinary prostate cancer workshop: Coordinated training of 95+ participants from 8 African countries. 
• Fellowship at PhenoPath laboratories: Managed travel logistics, co-defined learning objectives, and acquired funding for two Ivorian pathologists to receive training in Seattle on advanced oncology pathology.

Key focus: ESG | SDG 3, 9, & 17 | Strategic Partnership Development | Program Management | Health Financing
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Manage engagement of Industry Members of the WIPO Re:Search initiative at BVGH, which facilitates collaborations among global Member organizations to accelerate R&D of diagnostics, drugs, and vaccines for malaria, tuberculosis (TB), and neglected tropical diseases (NTDs). 

Manage all government and hospital relationships, oncology capacity building programs, and access to oncology medicines in both Rwanda and Cote d'Ivoire through our African Access Initiative (AAI). Implemented programs include bi-lateral fellowships, equipment placements, workshops, and facilitating research mentorships between African oncology researchers and senior-level Industry employees.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Member of the WIPO Re:Search initiative, which facilitates collaborations among global Member organizations to accelerate R&D of diagnostics, drugs, and vaccines for malaria, tuberculosis (TB), and neglected tropical diseases (NTDs). 


Member of the African Access Initiative (AAI), an innovative program launched in June 2017 that engages stakeholders across sectors to accelerate access to cancer treatment. Using data generated at the country-level by African hospitals and governments, AAI is expanding access to cancer medicines and technologies, strengthening healthcare infrastructure, and building clinical oncology and R&D capacity in Africa . As a concentrated effort of AAI, BVGH launched the African Consortium for Cancer Clinical Trials (AC3T) in November 2017. AC3T is a ﬁrst-of-its kind clinical trial consortium designed to support oncologists in Africa to conduct trials and gain a ﬁrsthand understanding of how their patients respond to life-saving medicines already approved in the United States. Desperately needed data on African ethnicities will be generated while providing access to innovative cancer medicines that will save patient's lives.
profile_positions.title: Associate Manager

profile_positions.description:
For my Engineering Senior Design project, I partnered with two other women in bioengineering to design a paper-based, microfluidic breast milk sensor. It detects E. coli in breast milk to ensure safe distribution in rural breast milk banks that lack proper storage and pasteurization practices. https://www.breastmilksensor.org/ 

Networked with a PATH (NGO) team who specialize in Maternal and Child Health. They have helped us better our understanding of the breast milk banking industry and best address our diagnostic device to the needs of the field. 

Applied for and received three grants to fund research materials and travel to test and implement the prototype in a PATH sponsored breast milk bank in Mumbai, India in June 2017. 

Presented our research project at the Global Health Conference at Yale University in April 2017.
profile_positions.title: Paper-Based Sensor to detect E. coli in Human Breast Milk

profile_positions.description:
• Adapt Electrochemical arsenic detecting device to trace fluoride levels in water 

• Displayed abilities in the lab; received training on 3D printer and laser cutting devices 

• Demonstrated ability to work independently in the lab as well as under supervision from advisor in Bioengineering Department at Santa Clara University
profile_positions.title: Bioengineering Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
Volunteered monthly to ride my bike to collect food from farmer's markets, grocery stores, and restaurants and deliver to local food pantry. The goal is to use bicycles to reduce food insecurity and solve community challenges. 

Circular economy | SDG | Zero-emission | ESG

I co-organize and lead bi-quarterly One Step Ahead outreach events with neighboring high schools to engage more young girls in the STEM fields. For one of the electrical engineering themed event, we began with a lesson on circuits and then taught 20 girls (9-12th grade) to build their own thermostat on a breadboard. Another recent event includes acting as classroom leader at SCU Go Green event to endorse engineering and environmental awareness in girl scout troops in 4th-8th grade.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer at Transitional Housing for Victims of Domestic Abuse
volunteer_experiences.description: One evening per week I volunteer with women and children who suffer from domestic violence. Form meaningful relations by going regularly.

Raise money through Philanthropy events for Women's Cardiac Care. Volunteer at Princess Project where I helped high school girls from low-income families "shop" for their prom dresses and jewelry in a store of donated items.
